items.question: In the life cycle of Polysiphonia, if carpospores give rise to tetrasporophytes and tetraspores produce gametophytes, what explains the chromosome number variation in different phases?
options: A) Meiosis occurs during carpospore formation
B) Meiosis occurs during tetraspore formation
D) Fertilization occurs twice per cycle

items.question: The evolutionary significance of heteromorphic alternation of generations in brown algae compared to isomorphic patterns suggests:
options: A) Adaptation to different ecological niches by different phases

items.question: In Anthoceros, the unique feature of indeterminate growth of sporophyte with intercalary meristem indicates:
options: A) Primitive condition linking to vascular plants

items.question: The presence of conducting strands in the seta of Polytrichum but not in other mosses suggests:
options: B) Parallel evolution of conducting tissues
C) Secondary loss in other mosses

items.question: If a Chara species shows 89% reduction in chromosome number from zygote to mature plant, this indicates:

options: A) Increasing cellular differentiation and complexity

items.question: The phenomenon of "false branching" in Scytonema differs from true branching because:
options: B) Hormogonia break through sheath laterally

items.question: Gemma cups in Marchantia exhibit bilateral symmetry rather than radial, which suggests:
options: B) Evolutionary link to higher plants

items.question: The reduction of chromosome number in the apophysis cells of moss sporophyte compared to spore mother cells indicates:
options: C) Meiosis has not yet occurred

items.question: In Ectocarpus, the plurilocular and unilocular sporangia on the same plant producing different spore types demonstrates:
options: B) Temporal separation of sexual and asexual cycles

items.question: The placement of Gnetales with angiosperms in some molecular phylogenies despite their gymnospermous features suggests:

items.question: The conflict between morphological and molecular data in placing Ceratophyllum (hornworts) indicates:

options: A) Reduced resistance proportional to fourth power of radius

items.question: Kranz anatomy's efficiency in C4 plants results from:
options: C) Spatial separation of C3 and C4 cycles

options: A) Secondary growth is exclusive to dicots
